name: AudioManager
tagline: A simple way to manage audio
body:
### Download latest version [here](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/4375689/Permanent/AudioManagerLatest.unitypackage)

### Cool editor window
AudioManager (in lack of a fancy name), is a nifty little extension for Unity, which allows you to easily manage and play audio. Instead of keeping track of multiple audio sources, all your sounds are grouped in a single window, as shown below:

![AudioManager screenshot](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/4375689/Permanent/AudioManager2.PNG)

### Crazy convenient methods
AudioManager automatically generates convenient static methods, to play your sound effects. So to play a sound all you have to do is call the appropriate method. If you're using an IDE with autocompletion it will pop up as a suggestion:

![AutoCompletion](https://dl.dropbox.com/u/4375689/Permanent/AutoCompletion.png)

### Bug annihilation
The AudioManager will be available on the Asset Store for free, once it has been through some more bugtesting. I would be very thankful if you took some time to test the AudioManager, and report any bugs you find to mathiassoeholm@gmail.com

### Feedback
If you have any suggestions, complaints, future requests or just want to say hi! Shoot me an email at mathiassoeholm@gmail.com
